title: (Re-)Introduce ARMv7+NEON Android and GNU/Linux targets

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Even though ARMv7 Android doesn't guarantee the presence of NEON, most devices have it and e.g. Firefox opts not to support ARMv7 devices that don't have it. (Notably the Tegra 2-based ones.)

To allow Rust code, including the standard library, to unconditionally use NEON in such a scenario, it would help a lot if upstream Rust supported an ARMv7+NEON Android target. (NEON support was [explicitly removed](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/38413) from `armv7-linux-androideabi`.

In order to test code on a system that has all the usual tooling, it's useful to have a corresponding GNU/Linux target, too. NEON was [explicitly removed](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/35814) from `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` and [also](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/48466) from `armv7-unknown-linux-musleabihf`.

Please add new `androideabi` and `gnueabihf` ARMv7 targets that have NEON enabled and a NEON-enabled standard library shipped via `rustup` so that `std::simd` ends up compiled with NEON enabled. (See the [issue about boolean reductions there](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/stdsimd/issues/362).)

How to name these is a total bikeshed, but as a starting point, I suggest `armv7neon-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` and `armv7neon-linux-androideabi`.
